a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Obesity is defined as having a body-mass index (BMI) equal to, or greater than, 30. BMI is a person's weight
(in kilograms) divided by their height (in meters) squared.
Data source: World Health Organization - Global Health Observatory (2024)
Note: To allow for comparisons between countries and over time, this metric is age-standardized.
